vamartid.test1._email

Class MY_socket_SERVER

  • java.lang.Object
    • vamartid.test1._email.MY_socket_SERVER

  • public class MY_socket_SERVER
extends java.lang.Object
    This class MY_socket_SERVER runs the server Creates a threat for each server singed in the server each thread have a method ServerActionsHandler running

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MY_socket_SERVER() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean accept_login(java.net.ServerSocket SRVSOCK, java.net.Socket SOCK)
      This method accept_login takes the Server's and the Client's socket receive an Account object(username and password fields) and checks and by using a JmailHelp object check's if the login that came was valid or not
      void accept_register(java.net.ServerSocket SRVSOCK, java.net.Socket SOCK)
      This method accept_register takes the Server's and the Client's socket and by using a JmailHelp object it writes in the file with the accounts the new account if there wasn't one with the same name
      void delete_mail(java.net.ServerSocket SRVSOCK, java.net.Socket SOCK)
      This method delete_mail takes the Server's and the Client's socket, receives a number finds the email which is declared by that number and by using a JmailHelp object it deletes the email's file
      void logout(java.net.ServerSocket SRVSOCK, java.net.Socket SOCK)
      This method logout takes the Server's and the Client's socket sets the user as logged out in status
      static void main(int port) 
      void send_mail_catalogue(java.net.ServerSocket SRVSOCK, java.net.Socket SOCK)
      This method send_mail_catalogue takes the Server's and the Client's socket and by using a JmailHelp object it finds the mails of the user (txt files in certain folder) make them Email objects place them in a array and sent the Object array through the stream
      void send_mail(java.net.ServerSocket SRVSOCK, java.net.Socket SOCK)
      This method send_mail takes the Server's and the Client's socket, receives an email object and by using a JmailHelp object it saves it to the receiver's folder
      void ServerActionsHandler(MY_socket_SERVER SERVER, java.net.ServerSocket SRVSOCK, java.net.Socket SOCK, SocketStatus a)
      This method ServerActionsHandler takes the Server's and the Client's socket,this is the Server's thread manager This method checks if the client ( Socket Status a ) is logged in or not and gives him the choices for each status and for each his order respectively psevdocode while the user has not exit do if loged in he can refresh/delete/read/new/logout if not he can login/register/exit
      void set_read_mail(java.net.ServerSocket SRVSOCK, java.net.Socket SOCK)
      This method set_read_mail takes the Server's and the Client's socket, receives a number finds the email which is declared by that number and is open in a client and by using a JmailHelp object it changes it's isNew field in the email's file

      • accept_login

        public boolean accept_login(java.net.ServerSocket SRVSOCK,
                            java.net.Socket SOCK)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        This method accept_login takes the Server's and the Client's socket receive an Account object(username and password fields) and checks and by using a JmailHelp object check's if the login that came was valid or not
        Parameters:
        SRVSOCK - is the server socket
        SOCK - is the client socket
        Returns:
        true if the login was sent and was successful or return false if it was not successful
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if there was a stream problem

                     throws java.lang.Exception

        Parameters:
        SRVSOCK - is the server socket
        SOCK - is the client socket
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Exception if there was a stream problem

                      java.net.Socket SOCK)

      • ServerActionsHandler

        public void ServerActionsHandler(MY_socket_SERVER SERVER,
                                 java.net.ServerSocket SRVSOCK,
                                 java.net.Socket SOCK,
                                 SocketStatus a)
                          throws java.lang.Exception
        This method ServerActionsHandler takes the Server's and the Client's socket,this is the Server's thread manager This method checks if the client ( Socket Status a ) is logged in or not and gives him the choices for each status and for each his order respectively psevdocode while the user has not exit do if loged in he can refresh/delete/read/new/logout if not he can login/register/exit
        Parameters:
        SERVER - is MY_socket_SERVER object of this class
        SRVSOCK - is the server socket
        SOCK - is the client socket
        a - is a SocketStatus object(declares if current thread client is logged in)
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if there was a stream problem
